identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a textile ERP that feels like a Swiss cockpitâ€”precise, industrial, and beautiful.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Industrial Precision with Atelier Elegance.
Content is King: Data is the art. The grid is the canvas.
Zoom In: Focus on the texture of the data (typography, spacing).
Negative Space: Use whitespace to separate complex data sets.
Contrast: High contrast for readability in factory environments.

heading.usage: Page titles, Widget headers, KPI values

body.usage: General UI text, labels, form inputs

rules: Overlines (e.g., 'STATUS') must be Uppercase + tracking-widest + text-xs.
Data cells must use tabular-nums for alignment.

surfaces.glass_header: bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-md border-b border-slate-200 sticky top-0 z-50

data_grid.name: ExcelGrid
data_grid.description: A high-density, editable table wrapper around Shadcn Table.

form_view.name: EntityForm
form_view.layout: Sheet (Side Drawer) for quick edits, Full Page for creation.
form_view.style: Two-column grid for fields, distinct sections for related data.

status_badge.name: StatusBadge
status_badge.style: rounded-full px-2.5 py-0.5 text-xs font-medium ring-1 ring-inset

visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle noise texture on the Sidebar to give it a 'fabric' feel.
visual_enhancers.shadows: shadow-sm for cards, shadow-xl for floating drawers.

images.description: Close up of fabric texture, use for 'Material' card backgrounds or empty states.
Fabric rolls, use for 'Inventory' or 'Production' headers.

assets.icons: Lucide React (default). Use thin strokes (1.5px) for elegance.

universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for text.
Do not center align the app container.
All interactive elements must have data-testid.
Inputs and Buttons must have distinct focus states (ring-2 ring-blue-500).
instructions_to_main_agent: 2. Create a 'Layout' component that handles the Sidebar and Header structure.
3. Implement the 'ExcelGrid' using TanStack Table (headless) + Shadcn UI Table (visuals).
4. Ensure the 'Form' view handles file uploads gracefully (use a drag-and-drop zone).
5. Use the provided images for the 'Sample Development' module empty states.
